column1:
فائر فاکس ری سیٹ کریں – آسانی سے سب مسائل کو ٹھیک کریں۔

\

اگرآپ کے فائر فاکس میں کچھ مسائل آ رہے ہیں تو اسے ری سیٹ کرنے سے وہ ٹھیک ہو سکتے ہیں. ری سیٹ فیچر آپ کی ضروری معلو مات جیسے کہ بک مارکس اور کھلے ٹیبز کو محفوظ کرتے ہوئے فائر فاکس کو فیکٹری ڈیفالٹ حالت میں لے آتا ہے جس سے بہت سے مسائل ٹھیک ہو جاتے ہیں۔. \

فائر فاکس کو اس کی بنیادی حالت میں لائیں۔

\
1. Click this Refresh Firefox button directly
column2:
if you are viewing this page in Firefox.
This won't work if you are using a different browser or on a mobile device.\

column1: • You can also find a Refresh Firefox button at the top of the Firefox about:support Troubleshooting Information page. \

column2: click Refresh Firefox in the confirmation window that opens.\

column1: • Firefox will close to refresh itself. When finished
column2: a window will list your imported information. Click Finish and Firefox will open.\

column1: Note: There's also a Refresh Firefox button in the Firefox Safe Mode window
column2: if you can't start Firefox normally. If you are unable to find the Refresh Firefox button on your version of Firefox
column3: you can also do a manual refresh by creating a new profile. See instructions on how to create a new profile.\

column1: آپ کی تمام ترتیبات اور ذاتی معلومات کو محفوظ کیا جاتا ہے پروفائل کے فولڈر میں. ری سیٹ فیچر ایسے کام کرتا ہے کہ آپ کی ترتیبات اور اہم اعداد و شمار کو محفوظ کرتے وقت یہ ایک نیاپروفائل فولڈر بناتا ہے۔\

column1: Note: Your old Firefox profile will be placed on your desktop in a folder named "Old Firefox Data." If the reset didn't fix your problem you can restore some of the information not saved by copying files to the new profile that was created. If you don't need this folder any longer
column2: you should delete it as it contains sensitive information.\

column1:
Send plugin crash reports to help Mozilla improve Firefox

\
This error means that a plugin (like Adobe Flash) has crashed. Simply reloading the page will restart the plugin
column2: and your video (or other content) will be shown again. Before reloading the page you can send a crash report to Mozilla by clicking on Send crash report. These crash reports help us make improvements to Firefox.\

column1: \
This error means that a plugin (like Adobe Flash) has crashed. Simply reloading the page will restart the plugin
column2: and your video (or other content) will be shown again. Before reloading the page you can add a comment to explain how it happened and send a crash report to Mozilla by clicking on Send crash report. These crash reports help us make improvements to Firefox.\

column1: \
A plugin is a piece of software that displays internet content that Firefox is not designed to display. This usually includes video
column2: audio
column3: online games and presentations that are made in patented formats. Plugins are created and distributed by the companies that make those patented formats. Some common plugins are Adobe Flash
column5: and Microsoft Silverlight. \

column1: A crash happens when a piece of software abruptly stops working. Plugins sometimes crash for various reasons
column2: and cause Firefox to crash along with it. For more information about Firefox crashes
column4: prevent and get help fixing crashes. Some plugins load separately from Firefox
column5: allowing Firefox to stay open if the plugin crashes.\

column1:
What information is sent in a crash report?

\
Crash reports only include technical information to help Firefox developers determine what went wrong
column2: and how to fix it. These reports do not include personal information. The information sent in a report includes:\

column1: • version of Firefox you were using\
This information is subject to the Firefox Privacy Policy.\

How do I keep plugins from crashing?

\
Many problems with plugins can be solved by updating to the latest version of the plugin. \
The name of the plugin that crashed can be found in the error message.\
\

Where can I get more info about Adobe Flash crashes?

\
See Adobe Flash plugin has crashed - Prevent it from happening again.\
Breakpoints can trigger Firefox's hang protection. You can disable hang protection by setting dom.ipc.plugins.timeoutSecs to -1. See the Mozilla Developer Network documentation for details.\

Private Browsing - Browse the web without saving information about the sites you visit

\

column2: Firefox remembers lots of information for you - like the sites you've visited. There may be times
column4: when you don't want people with access to your computer to see this information
column5: such as when shopping for a present. Private Browsing allows you to browse the Internet without saving any information about which sites and pages you’ve visited. We'll show you how it works.\

column1: \

column2: =fx21
column5: =fx24

column1: Important: Private Browsing doesn't make you anonymous on the Internet. Your Internet service provider
column2: employer
column3: or the sites themselves can still track what pages you visit. Private Browsing also doesn't protect you from keyloggers or spyware that may be installed on your computer. \

How do I turn off Private Browsing?

\

column1: \

• The windows and tabs you were using when you enabled Private Browsing will appear
column2: and you can use Firefox normally. The Firefox window title will no longer say (Private Browsing)The Firefox button will turn orange again (for Windows XP the Firefox window title will no longer say (Private Browsing)) when Private Browsing is off.\

column1: • Visited pages: No pages will be added to the list of sites in the History menu
column2: the Library window's history list

column1: • Form and Search Bar entries: Nothing you enter into text boxes on web pages or the Search bar will be saved for Form autocomplete.\
• Passwords: No new passwords will be saved.\
• Download List entries: No files you download will be listed in the Downloads Window after you turn off Private Browsing.\
• Cookies: Cookies store information about websites you visit such as site preferences
column2: login status
column3: and data used by plugins like Adobe Flash. Cookies can also be used by third parties to track you across websites. For more info about tracking
column4: see How do I turn on the Do Not Track feature?\

column1: • Cached Web Content and Offline Web Content and User Data: No temporary Internet files (cached files) or files that websites save for offline use will be saved.\
• New bookmarks you create while using Private Browsing will be saved.\

• Any files you download to your computer while using Private Browsing will be saved.

column1: Safe Mode is a special Firefox mode that can be used to troubleshoot and fix problems. Safe Mode temporarily resets some settings and disables add-ons that might be causing problems. By comparing Firefox behavior in normal mode to its behavior in Safe Mode you may be able to pinpoint the cause of the problem. \

Note: Windows users may be familiar with a Safe Mode for Windows. Firefox Safe Mode has no connection to Windows Safe Mode.
\

Note: The Refresh Firefox feature can fix many issues by restoring Firefox to its factory default state while saving your essential information. Consider using it before going through a lengthy troubleshooting process.\

How to start Firefox in Safe Mode

\
Click the menu button \
\

column2: click help \

click Help and select Restart with Add-ons Disabled…. Firefox will start up with the Firefox Safe Mode dialog.

Note: You can also start Firefox in Safe Mode by holding down the shift key while starting Firefox.holding down the option key while starting Firefox.quitting Firefox and then going to your Terminal and running: firefox -safe-mode
You may need to specify the Firefox installation path (e.g. /usr/lib/firefox)
\

column1: • Clicking the Exit button cancels your attempt to get into Firefox's Safe Mode.\
• Clicking the Continue in Safe Mode button will temporarily disable your extensions and themes
column2: turn off hardware acceleration and reset toolbar and button customizations. When you leave Safe Mode and start Firefox up normally
column5: and settings will return to the state they were in before you entered Safe Mode.\

column1: • The Make Changes and Restart button is only enabled if you select one of the boxes above it. See the Make permanent changes to Firefox in the Safe Mode window section below for more information.\
\
• Clicking the Start in Safe Mode button will temporarily disable your extensions and themes

column1: • Clicking the Reset Firefox button will restore Firefox to its factory default state while saving your essential information. See Refresh Firefox - reset add-ons and settings for more information about this option.\

column1: If the problem still happens in Safe Mode
column2: it is not being caused by an extension or theme. Other possible causes could be plugins or changes made to Firefox preference settings
column3: which are not disabled in Safe Mode. See the following articles for solution:\

column1:
Make permanent changes to Firefox in the Safe Mode window

\
When you start Firefox in Safe Mode
column2: you can elect to make the following permanent changes by selecting a checkbox and clicking the Make Changes and Restart button.\

column1: Warning: When you make these changes and restart Firefox
column2: they will remain in effect from that point on
column3: unless you take additional steps to undo them. Some changes cannot be undone.\

column1: • Disable all add-ons: If you select this box and then click Make Changes and Restart then Firefox will start back up in its normal mode
column2: except all your extensions
column3: themes and plugins will be disabled (not uninstalled). To undo the change
column4: you will need to enable each extension and plugin listed in the Add-ons Manager. See this article if you need more help enabling your add-ons.\

column1: • Reset toolbars and controls: If you select this box and then click Make Changes and Restart then Firefox will start back up in its normal mode
column2: except any toolbar customizations you have made will be lost
column3: such as position of buttons and toolbars. If you later want to undo this change
column4: you will need to add back those customizations. See <a href="/ur/kb/customize-firefox-controls-buttons-and-toolbars">Customize Firefox controls
column5: buttons and toolbars for more help.\

column1: • Delete all bookmarks except for backups: If you select this box and then click Make Changes and Restart then Firefox will delete your current bookmarks and replace them with the default set. If you later want to undo the change
column2: you will need to restore your bookmarks from backup. See Restore bookmarks from backup or move them to another computer for more help.\

column1: • Reset all user preferences to Firefox defaults: If you select this box and then click Make Changes and Restart then all Firefox options and preferences will be set back to the default settings
column2: and any changes you made to them will be undone. This change will be hard to undo
column3: since you may not remember all of the settings you have changed.\

column1: • Restore default search engines: If you select this box and then click Make Changes and Restart then any of the default search engines you deleted will be restored. This does not remove any added search engines. To undo this change
column2: simply go to the Search Bar and remove the search engines you don't want. \

column1:
Firefox hangs after using it for a long time

\
The latest Firefox versions includes improvements in memory usage
column2: especially during long sessions. Update Firefox to the latest version.\

column1: Firefox may hang if left open for long periods of time. To fix the issue
column2: restart Firefox.\

column1: If you regularly leave Firefox open so that you return to where you left off
column2: you may want to use Firefox's Session Restore feature. For more information

column1:
Firefox hangs while loading the first window

\
If you have many tabs to restore
column2: Firefox may hang while loading those sites. Make sure that Don't load tabs until selected is checked in the Tabs panel of the Options
column3: linux">Preferences window so that only the last selected tab is loaded at startup. You can also try to use Tab Groups so that only websites in the visible tab group load first.\

column1:
Firefox hangs when downloading files or saving images

\
If Firefox hangs when you attempt to download a file or save an image
column2: try these solutions:\

column1: Firefox may hang when downloading files if your download history has grown too large. To clear the download history:\
<ol><li> <span class="for" data-for="not fx20"><span class="for" data-for="win">At the top of the Firefox window
column2: click on the Firefox button (Tools menu in Windows XP)
column3: and then click DownloadsOn the menu bar
column5: and then click DownloadsAt the top of the Firefox window
column7: and then click Downloads. The Downloads window will open.Click the Downloads button \

column1: \
and then click Show All Downloads. The Library window will open.\
• Click Clear List. The download history is cleared.Click Clear Downloads to delete the download history.\
• Download some sample files to see if the hanging has stopped.\
Firefox may hang if the last download folder location (e.g. a shared volume or USB drive) is no longer available. To fix this:\
<ol><li>Click the menu button <span class="for" data-for="not fx57">\
\
and choose Options.
column2: linux">Preferences.\
select Save files to and click the Browse button.\
choose a new folder location.\

See if you are now able to download files or save images. If this works

column4: and select Always ask me where to save my files. \

column1: A crash is what happens when Firefox closes or quits unexpectedly. After a crash
column2: you should see the Mozilla Crash Reporter appear. This article will help you fix crashes and show you how to get more help if you're having difficulties.\
